decisions.description: Were any of the Employee fields updated? If so write this change to the database.
decisions.name: Any_Employee_Updates_Needed
decisions.label: Any Employee Updates Needed?

decisions.description: If the user input values into the Employee Creation screen which resulted in an Employee being found where previously one was not found then update the Employee with the updated information.
decisions.name: Check_Employee_for_Updates_Decision
decisions.label: Check Employee for Updates?

decisions.description: If the existing Employee record has a blank email address but one was provided on the Employee Creation screen then update the Employee record accordingly.
decisions.name: Email_Address_Update
decisions.label: Email Address Update?

decisions.description: If the existing Employee record has a blank Payroll No but one was provided on the Employee Creation screen then update the Employee record accordingly.
decisions.name: Payroll_Number_Update
decisions.label: Payroll Number Update?

decisions.description: Were results returned for Employees searching by name?
decisions.name: Records_found_by_name
decisions.label: Records found by name?

decisions.description: If the existing Employee record has a blank Start Date but one was provided on the Employee Creation screen then update the Employee record accordingly.
decisions.name: Start_Date_Update_Decision
decisions.label: Start Date Update?

loops.description: Loop Employee Collection to Single Record
loops.name: Loop_Employee_to_Single
loops.label: Loop Employee to Single

fields.name: Employee_Name_Selection_DT1
fields.fieldText:
Choose Employee

We looked for an Employee with Payroll Number {!recordId.Employee_Payroll_No__c} but were unable to find one.


Searching for '{!recordId.Employee__c}' we found these results:

value.stringValue: Do you want to use one of these Employees?

fields.name: Employee_Name_Selection_Toggle_Message
fields.fieldText:
You must select an Employee from the list if you have opted to use an existing Employee record.


If the correct Employee is not listed above then please click the Toggle to disable the use existing Employee option and click Continue. You will then be taken to the screen to create a New Employee.

fields.name: sErrorScreen_DT1
fields.fieldText:
We encountered an error while linking this Case to an Employee.


{!$Flow.FaultMessage}


If you are able to resolve the issue yourself then please do so and try again. If not then raise a ticket on ServiceNow.

fields.name: EmployeeInput_DT1
fields.fieldText:
Create Employee

Please provide the required information to create the Employee record.


IMPORTANT: Please only ever use the Employee's real Payroll Number and Start Date. Using holding values such as TBC will cause issues.


NOTE: If The Case relates to more than one Employee then please link the Case to 'Multiple Employees' with Payroll Number 'Multiple Employees'.

validationRule.errorMessage: Employee Name must be 80 Characters or fewer
Payroll Number must be 20 Characters or fewer

fields.name: Found_Records_DT
fields.fieldText:
Choose Employee

We searched for Employees using the available data points and found this record:


Payroll Number: {!recordId.Employee_Payroll_No__c}

Email: {!f_Lower_EmailAddress}

value.stringValue: Is this the correct Employee for this Case?
